Priest.Action: Single-handedly turned the tide against vampires with skill and dignity.
Participated in intense, brutal combat resulting in massive vampire and human deaths.
Disbanded and integrated into regular society by decree, showing an ability to adapt and presumably coexist.
Comforts Lucy about the hardships of outpost life and promises to try to get her into a school with peers next year.
Takes Lucy's hand and invites her to town to help and get a change of scenery.
Encourages family to bow heads and say grace together, fostering family unity.
Plans to file paperwork in town and arranges for his daughter to come along, showing foresight and responsibility in balancing work and family needs.
Acknowledges his daughter's emotional needs and promises to find a solution next year for her schooling, demonstrating understanding but delayed action.
Aaron quickly reacts to an unknown threat by ordering to board up windows and doors, showing presence of mind and decisiveness.
Aaron attempts to use a powerful gun but obviously lacks familiarity with firearms, indicating a lack of skill in that area.
Approaches a dangerous situation where a young girl is threatened by a gang of factory workers with knives at her throat.
Stands calmly facing armed aggressors and folds his hands into prayer position, showing non-aggressive demeanor.
Walks through a hostile crowd, people fear him and step aside, indicating command and presence.
Confronts gang of armed factory workers threatening a child, showing courage and willingness to intervene.
Folds his hands into prayer position when faced with aggressors, which might indicate calmness and confidence or a deliberate psychological tactic.
Throws knives into the feet of hostile workers to incapacitate them before they can react.
Attempts to comfort the frightened girl after violent encounter but she flinches and runs away.
Kills the leader by severing his hand as he threatens a girl.
Expresses concern about harm to a little girl, shows desire to see other Priests despite prohibition, hints at doubt and questioning his own beliefs.
Appears internally conflicted and vulnerable, showing a 'hard shell cracking' when Koeppen calls himself a wicked man.
Maintains a guarded, neutral expression when confronted with harsh realities and forbidden knowledge.
Questions Clergy's secrecy and policies despite warnings, showing curiosity and doubt.
Attempts to seek out other Priests despite prohibition, indicating initiative and courage.
Expresses confusion and uncertainty about his own feelings and situation.
Maintains composure without changing expression when challenged, showing self-control and confidence.
Appears to become deflated and vulnerable when Koeppen dismisses him, revealing moments of emotional weakness.
Answers the boy's question gently and softly after the mother pulls him away.
Allows the boy and mother to avoid interaction by remaining mostly silent and letting them leave quickly.
Keeps a faded photo of the Pace family as a source of peace, indicating sentimental attachment and capacity for care.
Clutches rosary beads, suggesting internal conflict but also sincerity in his beliefs.
Clutches rosary beads and reflects quietly on his oath, showing inner conflict but steady composure.
Waits calmly in a grimy lobby alongside others, showing patience and situational awareness.
Answers the boy’s question softly and truthfully after the mother pulls the boy away, demonstrating emotional control and discretion.
Takes time to study a faded family photo for peace and reflection, indicating emotional intelligence but little direct action relevant to competence.
Remains alert to environmental cues such as the gunshot outside and responds by looking at the rosary but does not act immediately, showing situational awareness but possibly hesitation.
Prays late at night, showing discipline and focus under stress.
Listens to Aaron's distressing message about a lost and endangered person, makes the sign of the cross and clenches his fist showing concern and resolve.
Kneels and bows his head before the tribunal of Monsignors, showing respect and humility.
Thanks the Monsignors for meeting on short notice, demonstrating politeness and sincerity.
Calmly accepts the Priority Punch card from the messenger and uses a complex mechanical device to communicate with Aaron.
Shows controlled emotional response by making the sign of the cross and clenching his fist upon hearing bad news.
Kneels and respectfully addresses a powerful tribunal to discuss urgent matters.
Advocates for reinstatement of authority to help in the investigation, motivated by familial ties and concern.
Expresses turmoil when being denied permission to intervene, showing emotional investment.
Faces reprimand with resolve and maintains a moral stance by quoting scripture about good works.
Shows distrust and sees vampires as enemies despite Monsignor's call for tolerance.
Asks for his authority to be reinstated to help with the investigation, showing willingness to serve and confidence in his capabilities.
Insists on involvement despite being rebuked, demonstrating persistence but possible lack of awareness of boundaries.
Is taken aback and appears in turmoil when challenged, indicating some emotional vulnerability in a tense situation.
Quotes scripture confidently in the face of reprimand, showing intellectual preparation and strong personal conviction.
Fails to effectively counter Monsignor Orelas’ authority or concerns about transgressions, suggesting limited political or strategic skill.
Sits alone quietly in a soup kitchen where the homeless gather, clutching rosary beads, indicating personal reflection in a place serving the needy.
Does not acknowledge Koeppen's presence or toast to the poor souls around them, showing emotional distance or preoccupation despite the setting.
Responds respectfully to Monsignor Orelas without challenging authority, showing awareness of hierarchical protocol.
Does not assert or clarify his own position when pressed, potentially indicating passivity or lack of confidence.
Sits alone in contemplation with rosary beads, showing introspection and steady composure in difficult moments.
Remains silent and does not engage with Koeppen's drunken outburst or questions, possibly reflecting detachment or inability to address interpersonal conflict.
Looks at Koeppen with cold eyes, showing emotional distance and distrust.
Expresses frustration by asking 'Why won't they listen to me?'
Looks betrayed when surrounded and confronted by armed officers, indicating trust in Koeppen was misplaced.
Refuses to cooperate with the Church to be taken into custody, showing integrity and loyalty to his own values.
Violently disarms and attacks officers to protect himself in front of terrified families and homeless people.
Strips the gun from the trooper and disables eleven troopers with precise blows, protecting others from harm.
Prays for protection during an attack, resulting in the disappearance of enemy guns and safety of a little boy and his father.
Kneels at the altar, sincerely apologizing to God for causing offense, showing humility and remorse.
Strips a gun from an officer and incapacitate eleven troopers with precise and skillful blows.
Disappears after magically disarming troopers and protecting innocent civilians, indicating strategic and confident action.
Folds his hands into prayer calmly amid chaos and gunfire, showing composure but not directly impacting the situation.
Kneeling and praying with sincere remorse for offending God, demonstrating internal reflection but not related to competence in action.
Asks for forgiveness for what is yet to come, acknowledges personal struggle with sin.
Rides recklessly on a motorcycle through the city and wasteland, leaving unconscious bodies in his wake.
Expertly works his way through congested streets on a powerful motorcycle in heavy rain.
Approaches a heavily guarded checkpoint confidently, seemingly without hesitation.
Revs his bike and speeds through the massive door leaving unconscious bodies behind, indicating effective but possibly ruthless action.
Finds Shannon's dress in the wreckage, inhales it softly, showing a moment of tenderness and sentimentality.
Steps calmly into moonlight, interacts with Sheriff Hicks without aggression despite being threatened at gunpoint.
Rides confidently across the wasteland, skillfully handling his cycle at high speed.
Carefully examines fresh tire tread and surroundings upon arriving at Outpost 10, showing attention to detail and caution.
Enters a potentially dangerous, war-torn cabin alone, demonstrating bravery but also risking his safety.
Rides with Hicks to town, silently supports Hicks' confrontation with the snake-oil salesman.
Arrives calmly with Hicks in a reliable police vehicle, assessing the situation without rushing.
Allows Hicks to handle confrontation, showing no visible panic or unpreparedness in a tense situation.
Does not directly intervene when Hicks challenges the snake-oil salesman, possibly deferring to Hicks' judgment and skill.
Stands calmly as children gather around and whisper, showing presence in community.
Remains mostly passive during Hicks’ confrontation with the salesman, no direct interjection or support visible.
Remains calm and composed as the snake oil salesman flees, indirectly prompting the sheriff to reveal the scam.
Does not intervene directly in the confrontation but maintains a presence that influences others indirectly.
Pulls down the shade to avoid the stares of townspeople; remains silent when questioned, staring at a wanted poster.
Embraces his brother Aaron warmly when he arrives, returning the hug.
Sprinkles dirt on the coffin and offers prayers at the grave.
Pulls down the shade to avoid drawing attention from townspeople staring at him.
Stares silently at a yellowed wanted poster without responding to Hicks' questions about his abilities.
Tries to smile politely after tasting unpleasant stew, showing effort to be kind to Paddy.
Offers the uneaten stew to the dog instead of wasting it, showing consideration.
Feels uncomfortable discussing personal past connections with Aaron and deflects by focusing on a map.
Reaffirms to Aaron ‘You're my brother’ before promising to find Shannon, showing sincerity and trustworthiness.
Tries to politely conceal dislike of the stew, grimacing but attempting to smile.
Unrolls map, studies direction and identifies a plan to start at the reservation.
Avoids an uncomfortable conversation by shifting focus to the map and mission.
Affirms commitment to find someone despite potential risks, showing confidence and resolve.
Doesn't answer Aaron and avoids eye contact when told to bring her back.
Pays in full and straightforwardly buys bullets from the clerk, showing seriousness and trustworthiness.
Reassures Aaron that fault has nothing to do with her death, trying to comfort him.
Admits uncertainty about God's will, showing honesty and emotional openness.
Allows Sheriff Hicks to enter without confrontation despite tension.
Does not verbally engage or acknowledge Hicks, continuing work silently.
Calmly allows the sheriff in without confrontation, demonstrating control of the situation.
Continues working silently despite the sheriff's provocative statements, showing focus and composure.
Creates a carefully notched cross on a bullet, indicating preparation and skill.
Successfully snaps the cross bullet to disarm the sheriff's knife, demonstrating quick reflexes and precision.
Gives bullets to Hicks, anticipating his needs and providing protection.
Prays sincerely for the safety and protection of townspeople and their children at night.
Prepares bullets for Hicks, anticipating his needs ahead of time.
Confidently agrees to accompany Hicks without hesitation after assessing the situation.
Responds to Hicks' question regarding firearms with calm clarity and maintains composure.
Nods solemnly in response to Aaron's plea to find Lucy, showing quiet support.
Does not answer Aaron's question about whether prayer helped, letting the silence speak volumes.
Climbs on his cycle and leaves without verbally engaging further, showing minimal outward warmth or reassurance.
Nods solemnly in response to Aaron's plea, demonstrating understanding and commitment.
Responds briefly and sparingly to emotional questions, showing restraint but not offering clear reassurance.
Immediately mounts his bike and rides off without hesitation when Hicks suggests riding point, showing readiness and confidence in action.
Rides through the Nightshade Reservation with Hicks, observing the harsh conditions without disdain, focused on the mission.
Kicks the door of the crypt in despite rules to search for clues.
Kicks the crypt door in despite regulations, taking decisive action to advance investigation.
Recognizes importance of getting into crypts to find clues, showing insight.
Ignores legal constraints mentioned by Hicks, which may indicate recklessness.
Presses the Crypt Familiar for information despite its pleas and apparent fear, moves the heavy stone slab slightly causing distress.
Shows persistence in seeking the girl’s location, even when the Familiar warns of consequences.
Moves a heavy stone slab slightly to intimidate and gather information, showing physical capability and strategic pressure.
Calmly interrogates the Crypt Familiar and confidently states the master will be dead, demonstrating confidence and control.
Persists in questioning despite the Familiar's distress and threats, showing resolve and intimidation skill.
Leaps in front of Hicks to block his way, protecting him from the Familiars' attack.
Charges alone into a frenzy, breaking bones and defeating enemies to protect his group.
Holds the defeated enemies' weapons, signaling control and readiness rather than aggression.
Leaps in front to block Hicks' way, preventing a premature attack.
Charges into the frenzy with clean and calculated movements, taking down enemies skillfully.
Holds multiple weapons taken from defeated enemies, demonstrating control over the battlefield.
Uses ranged weapons effectively by tossing knives to disarm and injure enemies accurately.
Maintains calm and focus under pressure, asking strategic questions about Hicks’ injury to anticipate future needs.
States 'We don't want a fight. We're just looking for the girl.' showing a desire to avoid conflict and focus on a goal.
Calls the vampires murderers when they claim their nature made them so.
Insists 'We're not going anywhere until you tell us where she is.' demonstrating determination but also a firm and uncompromising stance.
Uses his black book and star-metal crosses to aggressively attack vampires to protect Hicks and others.
Leaps at a vampire to physically protect Hicks, urging him to focus.
Uses star-metal crosses as weapons by flicking them with a snap of his wrist, effectively injuring and disintegrating the vampire enemy.
Leaps to intercept a vampire attacking Hicks, subduing it quickly and violently with skill.
Commands Hicks to focus amidst the chaos, demonstrating leadership and control.
Rolls across the ground and launches a timely attack on two vampires, showing agility and fighting skill.
Grabs a Familiar by the scruff of the neck and raises a knife to them while Familiars are sobbing and lost everything important to them.
Tells the Familiars 'No more masters. Just you and me.'
Refuses to pursue the lead vampire, confidently asserting 'No need. He'll die at first light.'
Engages in a fierce hand-to-hand fight with the lead vampire, contending despite surprise attacks.
Misunderstands or incompletely processes the Familiar's frantic warning about the 'metal beast' and smoke.
Notices Hicks' injury and asks about his arm, showing concern.
Tucks a knife from a dead Familiar into his waistband, indicating practical awareness but neutral in warmth.
Accuses Hicks of lacking stomach for the fight and tells him to head back, showing bluntness and possibly harshness.
Emerges from a crypt exhausted but holding the lead vampire's severed head, demonstrating successful combat and resourcefulness.
Notices Hicks' injury and assesses the situation calmly, showing awareness and care.
Finds and takes a knife from a dead familiar, showing situational awareness and preparedness.
Accuses Hicks of lacking the stomach for the mission and ordering him to return, demonstrating confidence but also potential disregard for team dynamics.
Admits he takes no pleasure in killing and acknowledges he has done more than his share.
Teaches Hicks how to shoot and kill vampires, showing willingness to help and share skills.
Demands Hicks's gun with a piercing stare and checks it with an intense demeanor.
Checks the chambers of the gun carefully and advises Hicks to know the trajectory of the target rather than anticipate it.
Demonstrates skill by firing a glowing coal of ash to teach Hicks a lesson on killing vampires, showing control and precision.
Admits to having done more than his share of killing and showing a resigned attitude that 'whatever they do to me I have it coming.'
Stares piercingly at Hicks and asserts control by demanding the gun, showing confidence and command.
Does not react defensively or rashly when Hicks questions his motives, maintaining calm and authority.
Explains the principle of 'two points' (A and B) and stresses the importance of knowing your target, indicating methodical thinking and teaching ability.
Points out there are ten crypts but only eight vampires, deducing that finding the missing vampires will lead to Lucy, showing analytical and strategic thinking.
Advises Hicks to get a good night's sleep before a rough ride and evaluates the vampire group by their bloodline strength, showing experience and foresight.
Hands the gun back to Hicks without comment after a tense exchange, which could be seen as either confidence or passivity depending on context but leans neutral here.
Referenced as someone who showed up to confront the snake oil salesman and helped evict him from town, preventing further exploitation.
Shows up with the local sheriff and boots the snake oil salesman out of town before he can make a single sale.
Marked by a cross tattoo, implying a symbolic or literal connection to faith or protection.
Priest is mentioned as 'one of the best' by Lucy, implying a reputation for skill or effectiveness.
Priest and Hicks are described as blazing across the playa, showing urgency and focus in their pursuit.
Offers water to Hicks and shows concern by asking about his arm.
Grabs Hicks' arm to check it, showing attention and care.
Calls Hicks 'a halfbreed' right after touching him, which may come off as insensitive or blunt.
Responds to Hicks' vulnerable confession by revving his cycle and speeding away without verbal reaction, possibly indicating discomfort or distancing.
Inspects tire tread and surroundings carefully, showing attention to detail in tracking.
Suddenly speeds away on motorcycle without much communication after sensitive conversation with Hicks.
Assesses Hicks' arm quickly, noticing complete healing and deducing Hicks is a halfbreed, showing observational skill.
Calmly shifts in his seat, making the old man lower his rifle and smile.
Accepts black tea offered by the old man without hesitation.
Calm and cool, shifts in his seat and draws the old man's gaze, helping to defuse a tense situation.
Listens patiently and with some sincerity to the old man's fevered beliefs about angels despite personal uncertainty.
Does not mock or dismiss the old man's story outright, showing tolerance.
Uncertain how to respond to the old man's statements, indicating possible reservation or distance.
Listens attentively to the Old Man's story and asks clarifying questions about the claimed miracle.
Appears unsettled and unsure how to respond to the Old Man's fevered belief.
Tries to engage the Old Man in conversation, showing interest in his words and story.
Accepts the homemade cross from the Old Man appreciatively, recognizing the care put into it.
Keeps an open mind about the Old Man despite others (Hicks) dismissing him as crazy.
Tries changing the subject to gain useful information, considers possible leads from the old man's words and cross
Seems unsure what to make of the old man and does not immediately act on his intuitions
Warns Hicks to watch for booby traps before entering the castle.
Silently leads the way into the castle without showing overt friendliness or interaction.
Surveys the ruins carefully, identifies the strategic use of abandoned structures by vampires, and warns about booby traps before entering.
Instructs Hicks to stay put and shoot anything that isn't him coming up the stairs, then proceeds alone into the dark catacombs.
Takes initiative to explore the dark and dangerous catacombs alone to find Lucy, showing confidence and decisiveness.
Instructs Hicks to stay put and shoot anything that comes up the stairs except himself, indicating a tactical mindset and trust in his own abilities.
Does not respond to Hicks’ criticism or doubts, maintaining focus and calm under pressure.
Moves quietly and cautiously through the catacomb, showing focus but not hostility toward surroundings.
Covers his nose and inspects the area carefully, indicating sensitivity to environment.
Crouches to examine two bodies found in the animal pen, showing attentiveness and concern.
After being attacked, uses instinct to defend himself aggressively and fight back without hesitation.
Moves quietly and cautiously through a dark catacomb, showing careful navigation and awareness.
Upon sudden attack, instantly folds and rolls to evade damage, then recovers quickly with a powerful kick off the wall.
Locks arms around attacker and slams it against the wall, using the torch light to illuminate it and gain an advantage.
Stares silently at the Priestess, revealing a shared past but withholding personal feelings or explanations.
Gently counters aggressive moves, then embraces the Priestess' arms to illuminate her face, showing a readiness to connect and reveal truth.
Does not confirm allegiance to the Clergy, indicating independence or mistrust, withholding openness.
Responds to the Priestess' suspicion with a brief, probing question instead of aggression or outright dismissal.
Immediately responds to Hicks' gunfire incident by proceeding to check on him and the situation, showing care and responsibility.
Silent during tense moments, neither affirming nor rejecting the Priestess directly, maintaining distance.
Locks arms around the shape's arms, slams it against the wall, uses torchlight to identify it.
Engages silently and confidently with the Priestess, holding his ground and responding calmly to her suspicion.
Starts moving toward the sound of gunfire immediately, showing situational awareness and concern for ally Hicks.
Leaps to aid the Priestess by attacking the vampire directly, coordinating silently with her
Does not verbally communicate or engage with Hicks, who is frightened and confused
Shows protective and courageous behavior by facing the vampire and trying to subdue it
Approaches the unknown threat with senses on full alert, assessing the situation calmly.
Leaps up and over the stairway aggressively to engage the enemy, demonstrating physical skill and confidence.
Rolls across the floor keeping low to avoid attacks while coordinating silently with the Priestess.
Leaps from below and takes advantage of distraction to attack the creature's back, showing tactical awareness and coordination.
Priestess catches Priest after he is thrown; they land safely together.
Priest and Priestess share a moment of eye contact and synchronized prayer.
Leaps courageously onto the creature and decapitates it to protect the Priestess and others.
Leaps through the air using frozen rocks as steps, attacks the creature decisively, and successfully decapitates it with a familiar knife before landing safely.
Shares in the Priestess’s memory and feelings about restless nights, showing empathy and connection.
Silent hesitation when Priestess expresses affection toward him, appearing unsure.
Stares at the Priestess, unsure what to say in a personal moment.
Observes and correctly identifies the underground chamber as a tomb big enough for an army.
Leads the group cautiously and attentively, signaling to halt upon sensing something ahead.
Does not engage with Hicks's awkward attempts at conversation or questions, remains focused on the task.
Suggests going to see the next nearest town, Jericho, to investigate the aftermath.
Walks into a devastated home, calmly places the needle back on the phonograph despite the destruction, indicating composure and situational awareness.
Is found kneeling with head down in prayer among a dangerous and chaotic scene, potentially showing passivity or lack of immediate action.
Kneels and prays before the crucified bodies of fallen priests, showing respect and solemnity.
Kneels in prayer before three crucified dead Priests, showing composure in a grim situation.
Refuses to return to the Cities despite pressure, indicating resolve and a break from conditioning.
Speaks for the Priestess, sharing a heavy burden in silence and solidarity.
Looks at the pyre with somber acceptance, acknowledging shared suffering with the Priestess.
Decides firmly that they are not going back to the Cities despite a lifetime of conditioning and the risk that they will 'burn for this.'
Demonstrates understanding and insight by putting together the significance of the railroad spike found in the remains.
Rarely speaks, lets others do the talking and does not offer explanations or plans beyond the firm stance.
Engages cooperatively with others to analyze the map and clues.
Expresses concern and trouble when considering dangers faced by others.
Interprets the railroad spike as a clue and pushes the group to find it, showing insight.
Questions Hicks about the last stop on the railroad line and carefully analyzes the map with a troubled but thoughtful demeanor.
Suggests that the factions won't be harmed by the sun because the Cities are covered in industrial smoke blocking sunlight, revealing strategic understanding.
Lies close by, asleep while Hicks and Priestess converse
Lies asleep while others set up camp and discuss strategy at a challenging mountain pass.
Present at a critical and dangerous stage of the journey, proceeding with the group calmly.
Described as part of a small, nearly extinct group of Priests who must carry out harsh duties like killing infected family members to protect others.
Portrayed as methodical and precise, giving clear instructions to others during a dangerous mission, showing a sense of responsibility and leadership.
One Priest is described as 'fearsome' and smiling, enjoying the action, suggesting possible cruelty or aggression.
Motions with his hand to others, giving precise instructions; coordinated movements of the group.
Smiling, enjoying the action in a dangerous situation.
Orders a retreat to protect survivors in a losing battle.
Tries to comfort the Priestess when she loses faith, reassuring her they will face the unknown together.
Shares a riddle to engage the Priestess, showing an attempt to connect and lighten the mood.
Acknowledges the grim reality they face by saying 'We won’t survive this.' with a pause, showing honesty but also a lack of false hope.
Smiles back at Priestess and kisses her, breaking years of ritual and tradition, sharing a moment of genuine affection and belonging.
Quickly turns after hearing sounds and prepares for attack, dives just in time to avoid a claw attack.
Stands alert and waits calmly for the opponent to reveal themselves instead of rushing.
Backflips and gears up for another attack immediately after narrowly dodging, showing readiness and skill.
Engages in a confrontation with an enemy who mocks him for losing a step, suggesting he might be less capable than before.
Maintains composure when threatened by Hicks, speaks calmly and confidently about the situation and their code.
Calls out Hicks for his true intentions and reveals critical information calmly under threat.
Does not immediately react physically or verbally to Hicks' threats, showing restraint and control.
Refuses to justify or negotiate on the principle that it is their way, showing rigid adherence but lack of flexibility.
Does not respond to the Priestess’ gaze or offer emotional support, potentially indicating aloofness.
Tells allies to get on the train while he intends to catch up alone, drawing enemy attention to himself.
Instructs the others to get on the train while he plans to catch up, showing leadership and tactical thinking.
Banks his cycle to the left to lure the vampire riders away, taking initiative and calculated risk.
Gets thrown from his bike by a chain but quickly uses momentum to roll back onto his feet, demonstrating physical skill and resilience.
Sustains a serious stomach wound from the attack, indicating vulnerability or lack of complete control over the situation.
Defends himself skillfully and aggressively against multiple attackers to survive.
Ducks at the last second, grabs the chain, swings and kicks two riders off their bikes, showing agility and quick thinking.
Snaps the chain into a bullwhip, tangling bikes and crashing them, showing tactical use of environment and tools.
Engages in a brutal fight with stronger, faster opponents and manages to fend them off effectively.
Rips off helmets causing enemies pain and incapacitation, followed by physical attacks and disabling their vehicles.
Uses enemy equipment against them by throwing a helmet into a bike and causing a crash.
Wounds noted but no attempt at first aid, focusing immediately on defense and attack.
Prepares carefully by arming himself and taking an atomic craw before kicking the door in to face unknown dangers on the train car.
Moves cautiously and deliberately through the train cars, adjusting to darkness and assessing the environment.
Motors up to the train car riding the vampire cycle, swings onto the roof of the train despite heavy gunfire, showing physical skill and timing.
Collapses against the metal roof, appearing strained and close to passing out after the maneuver.
Expresses shock and disbelief upon seeing Black Hat alive, showing vulnerability and confusion.
Recognizes and questions the transformation of Black Hat's comrades, indicating concern for former allies.
Immediately understands the implication of Black Hat’s resurrection and transformation, indicating quick comprehension.
Reacts with shock and disbelief rather than taking immediate decisive action or displaying control.
Questions Black Hat about murdering innocents and interrogates his motives.
Preparing to fight Black Hat, accepting the confrontation without hesitation.
Warily eyes Black Hat, listens carefully to his words without immediate reaction.
Questions Black Hat directly about the morality of his methods, showing critical thinking.
Notices a distant black spec on the horizon and tightens his jaw, indicating awareness of threat and limited time.
Responds to Black Hat’s provocation quickly and confidently, indicating mental readiness.
Engages in combat with Black Hat with grace and skill described (e.g. graceful sweep and echo of combat).
Refuses to join Black Hat despite tempting offer of power and superiority, maintaining faith.
Engages in fierce combat to uphold his beliefs, showing resilience and integrity.
Shows no signs of cruelty or malice in fight, even when outmatched and in peril.
Engages in a fierce and dynamic fight atop a moving train, performing precise leaps from car to car under extreme conditions.
Despite skill and effort, is clearly outmatched by Black Hat, ends up exhausted, bloodied, and hanging off the edge of the train, vulnerable to attack.
Refuses to believe Black Hat's claim about the Order and his faith.
Has his hand swiped off and is dragged under the train, indicating a failure to avoid a clear attack or danger.
Clings desperately to the undercarriage despite severe injuries and moves hand over hand in agony.
Attempts to comfort Lucy by introducing himself and stating intention to take her home, despite her unresponsiveness.
Analyzes the sun and calculates trajectory and timing quickly and accurately, then makes a strategic decision to use Nitros Toggle and speed past the train engine confidently.
Fails to find any way to get inside the train despite furious efforts, indicating possible limitations or failure in access or planning.
Urgently demands Lucy be handed to him to protect her and stop the vampires, showing concern and trust in Hicks to help.
Arrives at the scene promptly after hearing gunfire and demands Lucy be handed over quickly, showing presence of mind and urgency.
Does not engage in the initial fight but appears ready and alert, positioning himself strategically by coming through the boarded hole.
Carries the unconscious Lucy to safety despite exhaustion.
Protects Hicks and Lucy by physically shielding them and praying in a desperate situation.
Shows horror and helplessness at seeing the Priestess sacrifice herself.
Carries the unconscious Lucy while climbing the ladder and rooftop, demonstrating physical capability and determination.
Declines Hicks' suggestion to jump from the train until they stop it, showing strategic thinking and caution.
Realizes the Priestess's suicidal intent but is powerless to intervene, indicating a limitation in influence or control.
Grabs Hicks and Lucy and makes a prayer gesture as a last resort action in a moment of crisis, showing presence of mind and attempting to act under extreme pressure.
Shields Hicks and Lucy with his body while falling through the air during the train crash.
Holding Lucy in his arms after the crash, showing protective care as she comes to.
Kneels beside the Priestess, taking her hand and trying to be strong for her in her final moments.
Recites a prayer solemnly to comfort and honor the Priestess.
Brushes the hair from the Priestess's face, showing tenderness and care.
Chooses to stay with the Priestess instead of pursuing Black Hat, prioritizing compassion over action.
Gives the Priestess a final kiss and cradles her as she dies, showing deep affection and sincerity.
Kneels beside the Priestess, offering comfort and a ritual of strength during her final moments.
Notices Black Hat escaping but chooses to stay with the dying Priestess instead of pursuing or reacting to the figure.
Speaks a familiar prayer solemnly and with gravity, showing emotional and spiritual control in a dire situation.
Gives a last kiss and cradles the Priestess' body as she dies.
Leaves quickly without engaging with Hicks and Lucy despite their presence and concern.
Saddles up and blazes towards the Cities with determination despite being bruised and bloodied.
His presence causes a strong reaction in the cathedral, showing he has significant influence and boldness.
Bursts into the chamber with force and anger, engages Black Hat in fierce combat, manages to send Black Hat flying into candle holders, starting a fire.
Stands shell shocked at the level of betrayal when confronting the Monsignors and Black Hat.
Sustains multiple injuries, including claw wounds and blood loss, and is ultimately overpowered by Black Hat, who lifts him off the floor by the throat.
Wrenches himself free from Black Hat's grip and escapes a deadly attack using the giant gold cross, showing resourcefulness and will to survive.
Locks the Monsignors in the collapsing chamber, sacrificing their safety but preventing their escape during chaos.
Whispers 'Forgive me' and makes the sign of the cross after the chamber collapse, demonstrating remorse and sincerity.
Examines Father Koeppen and confirms he is unharmed, then silently walks away, granting unspoken absolution.
Leaves Father Koeppen without any verbal encouragement, but his silent absolution renews Koeppen's faith and hope.
Believes again with renewed energy and presence of mind in front of the crowd.
Caught off guard by a profound question and realizes he has no answer.
Steps forward unarmed towards Hicks despite the threat, showing vulnerability and trust.
Maintains eye contact conveying something strong and personal transcending emotion, indicating sincerity and depth.
Disappears immediately after Hicks fires, evading the shot skillfully and unexpectedly.
Steps forward calmly toward a man holding a gun, showing confidence and control in a dangerous situation.
Clutches the well-worn photo of the Pace family, gazing thoughtfully at the warm glow from the cabin before placing the photo in his pocket.
Clutches a well-worn photo, reflects silently before taking off decisively into the night on his cycle toward an unknown destination.
Disappears into the emptiness of the wasteland confidently, indicating purposeful movement and initiative in a desolate environment.

Hicks.Action: Quickly scoops up the chain and wraps it tightly around the car door handle to slow down the vampires.
Places himself between Lucy and the door to protect her and holds off the vampires by firing bullets strategically, managing to kill one vampire with a well-placed shot.
Pain shoots up his body as he falls backwards after being slashed, but he still continues to fight and protect Lucy.
